document: Relational Algebra is a procedural query language used in database systems to define queries by applying a sequence of operations on relations.

questions.question: Relational Algebra is a procedural query language.
Relational Algebra is primarily used as a user-level query language.
The domain of Relational Algebra consists of a set of relations.
SQL is an example of a procedural query language like Relational Algebra.
Relational Algebra expressions produce relations as results.
The SELECT operation filters tuples based on a predicate.
The PROJECT operation selects specific rows from a relation.
Duplicate tuples are removed in the result of a PROJECT operation.
Union operations can only be applied to union-compatible relations.
Two relations with different numbers of attributes can be union compatible.
Set difference returns tuples that are present in both relations.
Cartesian product combines every tuple of one relation with every tuple of another relation.
Rename operation is represented by the symbol œÅ.
Rename operation is mainly used to change attribute values.
Natural join joins relations based on common attribute names.
Equi-join is a special case of theta join using only equality conditions.
Outer joins exclude tuples with no matching values.
Left outer join returns all tuples from the left relation.
Full outer join includes all tuples from both participating relations.
Intersection is considered a derived operation in Relational Algebra.
